attributes.action: Fund a post-Coronavirus social reconnection strategy
attributes.additional_details:
We face an epidemic of loneliness. Disconnected communities already cost the UK economy £32 billion every year (Eden Project 2019).  Half a million older people already live in 'self isolation' (Age UK 2016). 

Social distancing strategies - whilst necessary - will only worsen these trends. 

Better connected communities are better able to recover from shocks, such as flooding or a virus outbreak. With climate breakdown these kind of shocks will become more common.
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to invest at least 1% of the £12bn Coronavirus budget package - £120 million - in measures to address the ongoing impacts of social distancing strategies in the aftermath of current emergency. 

This is needed to fund investment in vital community spaces and services.
